RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 54. Claiming Purse 19400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Ent ered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MY SISTER PAM settled off the early pace inside, challenged toward the three eighths pole but checked in tight at the rail approaching the quarter pole, recovered stride and was eased off the rail on the far turn, dug in under steady stretch handling and cleared toward the wire WAGER WORTHY in the final yards. The latter rated the pace off the rail, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, was steadily handled leaving the turn, gave up the lead in later yards but held on for second. PETTYFORURTHOUGHTS stalked off the rail, challenged leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and was gaining on the runner-up. I SHALLBE RELEASED rounded the first turn about the three path, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn but flattened inside the eighth pole. WOODSONG'S CASTLE rounded the first turn five wide, started a bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the four path of the far turn and showed little in the lane. HOOK THE CHAIN raced in the six path the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path and showed little in the lane. GOLD PHOENIX raced four wide on the opening turn and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Wager Worthy
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,pressured 3/8,dug in lane,caught late,held on 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Pettyforurthoughts
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked off rail,challenged 3/8,off rail turn,gaining on 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 7F Dirt CR: 77. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 24200. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE FEBRUARY 24, 2021 OR CLAIMING PRICE $10,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 24 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000 (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JAMESTOWN ROAD rated close inside, bid leaving the quarter pole and came between horses mid turn, took the nod two deep leaving the turn and was kept alert to hold off FEEL THE LOVE through the stretch, while the latter saved ground off the pace and picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, drew aim three wide approaching the top of the lane, but was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. HOW IS SHE raced well off the pace and off the rail the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path and came along for third the final yards. MISS WAVE stalked two deep then challenged into the backstretch, took the nod nearing the seven sixteenths pole, came under pressure toward the three eighths, contested the edge at the rail on the far turn but was met leaving the turn and flattened stride. ARROWWOOD stalked from the three path, challenged toward the three eighths pole and stayed in range in the three path of the far turn before weakening. SECRET CASTLE bobbled leaving the gate but took the lead nearing the thirteen sixteenths pole and moved to the inside to set the pace, gave up the nod at the seven sixteenths pole, chased from that point but faded at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: How Is She
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,off rail,chased 7/16,4p far turn,along 3rd late

ENTRY.NAME: Jamestown Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,bid 1/4,between mid turn,nod 1/8,kept alert lane

ENTRY.NAME: Secret Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled break,early pace inside,met 1/2,chased,faded far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 57. Maiden Claiming Purse 20600. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Weight, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RUNNING FREE pressured the pace and raced close two deep on the turn, took the lead into the lane, dueled clear and widened the final sixteenth. YAZZERA (PER) chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and dueled clear for second later yards. SEAP set a pressured pace inside, contested the advantage at the rail on the turn, was met into the stretch and flattened the final sixteenth. TAKE CHARGE LISA chased outside, raced in the five path of the turn and passed rivals through the lane. HOLY HIP chased toward the inside, rounded the turn at the rail then flattened leaving the eighth pole. CATEGORYNINETYNINE gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path and showed little in the lane. PUERTORICAN DIVA chased toward the inside, rounded the turn off the rail but angled to the five path leaving the turn and showed little more. STORMI VANNA gave chase and rounded the turn about the four path. MIDNIGHT PASS gave chase and rounded the turn about the three path.

ENTRY.NAME: Holy Hip
ENTRY.OWNER: C M Racing Stables LLC and Lewis Jalen

ENTRY.NAME: Midnight Pass
ENTRY.OWNER: Tsiamis Arthur W and Pansiri Mihee

ENTRY.NAME: Puertorican Diva
ENTRY.OWNER: Iyacyas Racing LLC and Delgado William

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 16200. FOR FILLIES AND MARES FOUR YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE AUGUST 24, 2022. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since August 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Ent ered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CLASSIC COLORS rated close off the rail, closed to the front past the seven sixteenths pole and raced clear at the five sixteenths, widened at the rail on the far turn and was kept alert in the lane. DUSTWHIRL WONDER rated close inside, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and settled for second. CASTLE OF CAYLEE rounded the opening turn in the four path, gave chase into the backstretch and raced off the rail on the far turn, then flattened in the lane. LIFE IN FLASH saved ground into the first turn and settled well off the pace, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn five wide and ran evenly in the lane. SHE FIGURES saved early ground, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and rounded the far turn in the three and four paths, and showed little in the lane. PARTY MONSTER settled off the rail, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole then flattened in the four path of the far turn. SO RED THE ROSE set the early pace inside, was met toward the three quarter pole and rated close from that point, gave chase into the backstretch but weakened approaching the far turn. CHIT CHAT GIRL stalked the early pace from the three path, took the lead approaching the three quarter pole and rated the pace, came under pressure nearing the seven sixteenths pole, but was met past the pole and weakened at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: So Red the Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: early lead inside,met 3/4,chased 1/2,weakened near far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Classic Colors
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close,up past 7/16,clear 5/16,widened rail turn,kept alert

ENTRY.NAME: Life in Flash
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved gruond,well back,bid 3/8,5wd far turn,evenly lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 87. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since January 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 24 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Cons idered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ICING moved to the inside and rated a slim lead, kept the edge over MR CHANCE ROMANCE leaving the three eighths pole, cleared that one passing the quarter and was kept alert in the lane. The latter raced with the pace two deep and dueled from the three eighths pole, but dropped back past the quarter pole and had to settle for second best. BUDDY BUDDY ducked in and made contact with Personable leaving the gate then rated close inside, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, raced close at the rail on the far turn but flattened in the lane. JAXJAXXORJACKS was shuffled back at the break and raced in the five path of the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, ran at the rail on the far turn and showed little in the lane. PERSONABLE became fractious in the gate and was bumped at the break, rated close to the early pace about the three path, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path then flattened stride. JUBA BOUND rated close in the four path the first turn, gave chase toward the three eighths pole but flattened in the three path of the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Icing
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated slim lead inside,kept edge from 3/8,clear turn,kept alert

ENTRY.NAME: Jaxjaxxorjacks
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled back start,5p 1st turn,chased 3/8,rail far turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Mr Chance Romance
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace,dueled from 3/8,dropped back past 1/4,settled 2nd best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 58. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPARKLEINYOUREYE raced with the early pace two deep, took the nod passing the nine sixteenths pole and came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths, rounded the far turn at the rail and held well under steady stretch handling. JUMPIN JACK BRASS settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole and improved at the rail on the far turn, cleared second past the eighth pole and finished well. NO DENYING DENIS rounded the first turn in the four path, picked up the chase into the backstretch, raced in the four path of the far turn and came along for third the final yards. S S FRONTIER ANGEL raced with the early pace inside but steadied from tight quarters at the rail approaching the nine sixteenths pole, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. SNEAKY LYNK raced in the five path the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the four and five paths and showed little in the lane. JACKYSINTHECASTLE settled inside on the first turn, picked up the chase into the backstretch but faded past the five sixteenths pole. LOCKDOWN VANNA was not a factor. CARMELIZED took the lead past the three quarter pole and set the early pace about the three path, was met passing the nine sixteenths pole, gave chase into the backstretch then weakened in the three path of the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Sparkleinyoureye
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace,nod 9/16,pressured 5/16,rail far turn,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Jumpin Jack Brass
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 3/8,rail far turn,clear 2nd past 1/8,finishd well

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 85. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since Januar y 24 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since December 24 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NEVER COMPROMISE rounded the first turn about the four path and gave chase into the backstretch, raced in the three path of the far turn, dug in for the lead nearing mid-stretch, drew clear leaving the sixteenth pole and widened later yards. ALLEN CAN DO IT settled off the rail on the first turn, eased out into the backstretch and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, steadily improved in the three path of the far turn and finished well to take second the final strides. AARON'S TAP rated off the pace inside, bid nearing the three eighths pole and took the nod two deep approaching the quarter, but was met approaching mid-stretch and flattened late yards. REMYS SHOWTIME rated a slim lead inside, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole, was met toward the quarter, continued close at the rail on the far turn then flattened in the lane. SIENTE EL AMOR settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but flattened off the rail on the far turn. BOSS E BOOGS raced with the early pace two deep, gave chase toward the three eighths pole but dropped back past the five sixteenths and faded at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Aaron's Tap
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Allen Can Do It
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail 1st turn,eased out 1/2,chased 7/16,3p turn,up 2nd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 83. Claiming Purse 16900. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE AUGUST 24, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since August 24 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ELVIRUS saved ground well off the early pace, started his bid nearing the three eighths pole, steadily improved in the three path of the far turn, dueled to the front past the eighth pole and drew off the final sixteenth. ONE MORE FACTOR rated the early pace inside, was met leaving the first turn and dueled to recover the edge passing the three eighths pole, drew clear at the quarter pole, contested the edge at the rail on the far turn but was met past the eighth pole and relented the final sixteenth. FIVE STAR PHIL raced in the five path the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, came through the far turn at the rail, eased out leaving the turn, cleared third past the eighth pole and ran evenly in the lane. JAMMIN STILL raced well off the pace in the three path the first turn, eased out into the backstretch and gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the five path of the far turn then flattened in the lane. TWEET THIS rounded the first turn about the four path, picked up the chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn, then flattened stride while losing ground toward the head of the lane. JACK THE RIPPER (FR) tapered in and raced with the early pace two deep, moved to even terms and dueled with the edge from that point, was met passing the three eighths pole, dropped back at the quarter and weakened at the rail. INSTIGATED rated off the pace inside on the first turn, picked up the chase into the backstretch but weakened at the rail on the far turn and was eased in the lane. CONFUSION BABY BOY was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: Instigated
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside,chased 1/2,weakened rail turn,eased lane

ENTRY.NAME: Confusion Baby Boy
ENTRY.OWNER: Nunnally Mark E and C and B Stables

ENTRY.NAME: Elvirus
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid near 3/8,3p far turn,up past 1/18,drew off 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Jammin Still
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace 3p,chased 7/16,5p far turn,flattened lane
